channel.description: Recent content in Causality on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Compositional Atlas for Algebraic Circuits
item.description: This paper introduces a compositional framework for algebraic circuits, deriving novel tractability conditions for compositional inference queries and unifying existing results.

item.title: A Non-parametric Direct Learning Approach to Heterogeneous Treatment Effect Estimation under Unmeasured Confounding
item.description: Estimating heterogeneous treatment effects (CATE) under unmeasured confounding is revolutionized by a novel non-parametric direct learning approach using instrumental variables, offering efficient and…

item.title: A Simple yet Scalable Granger Causal Structural Learning Approach for Topological Event Sequences
item.description: S²GCSL: A novel scalable Granger causal structural learning approach efficiently identifies root causes of telecommunication network alarms by leveraging a linear kernel and incorporating expert knowl…

item.title: Automated Efficient Estimation using Monte Carlo Efficient Influence Functions
item.description: MC-EIF automates efficient statistical estimation for high-dimensional models, integrating seamlessly with existing differentiable probabilistic programming systems and achieving optimal convergence r…

item.title: Causal Discovery from Event Sequences by Local Cause-Effect Attribution
item.description: CASCADE algorithm unveils hidden causal structures in event sequences by minimizing description length, surpassing existing Granger causality-based methods.

item.title: Causal Effect Identification in a Sub-Population with Latent Variables
item.description: This paper introduces a novel algorithm to accurately compute causal effects within specific sub-populations, even when hidden factors influence the data, advancing causal inference significantly.

item.title: Causal Inference in the Closed-Loop: Marginal Structural Models for Sequential Excursion Effects
item.description: Researchers introduce a non-parametric causal inference framework to analyze closed-loop optogenetics designs, revealing previously hidden causal effects of neural circuit manipulations on behavior.

item.title: Causal vs. Anticausal merging of predictors
item.description: Causal assumptions drastically alter predictor merging, with CMAXENT revealing logistic regression for causal and LDA for anticausal directions.

item.title: ChronoEpilogi: Scalable Time Series Selection with Multiple Solutions
item.description: ChronoEpilogi efficiently finds all minimal sets of time-series variables optimally predicting a target, improving forecasting while providing crucial insights for knowledge discovery and causal model…

item.title: Clustering in Causal Attention Masking
item.description: Researchers strengthen understanding of transformer self-attention by proving asymptotic convergence to single clusters under causal masking, linking it to the Rényi parking problem.

item.title: Conditional Generative Models are Sufficient to Sample from Any Causal Effect Estimand
item.description: ID-GEN: Sample high-dimensional interventional distributions using any conditional generative model!

item.title: Conditional Outcome Equivalence: A Quantile Alternative to CATE
item.description: Researchers introduce the Conditional Quantile Comparator (CQC) for analyzing heterogeneous treatment effects, offering an improved approach by combining the strengths of CATE and CQTE while overcomin…

item.title: Controlling Counterfactual Harm in Decision Support Systems Based on Prediction Sets
item.description: AI decision support systems can unintentionally harm users; this paper introduces a novel framework to design systems that minimize this counterfactual harm, balancing accuracy and user well-being.

item.title: Detecting and Measuring Confounding Using Causal Mechanism Shifts
item.description: This paper proposes novel measures to detect and quantify confounding biases from observational data using causal mechanism shifts, even with unobserved confounders.

item.title: Differentiable Structure Learning with Partial Orders
item.description: This research introduces a novel plug-and-play module that efficiently integrates prior partial order constraints into differentiable structure learning, significantly improving structure recovery qua…

item.title: Disentangled Representation Learning in Non-Markovian Causal Systems
item.description: This paper introduces graphical criteria and an algorithm for disentangling causal factors from heterogeneous data in non-Markovian settings, advancing causal representation learning.

item.title: Do Finetti: On Causal Effects for Exchangeable Data
item.description: Causal inference revolutionized: New framework estimates causal effects from exchangeable data, enabling simultaneous causal discovery and effect estimation via the Do-Finetti algorithm.

item.title: Efficient Policy Evaluation Across Multiple Different Experimental Datasets
item.description: This paper presents novel graphical criteria and estimators for accurately evaluating policy effectiveness across multiple experimental datasets, even when data distributions differ.

item.title: Efficiently Learning Significant Fourier Feature Pairs for Statistical Independence Testing
item.description: This research introduces LFHSIC, a novel, linear-time independence test that significantly outperforms existing methods, especially for high-dimensional data, by learning optimal Fourier feature pairs…

item.title: Estimating Heterogeneous Treatment Effects by Combining Weak Instruments and Observational Data
item.description: This study develops a novel two-stage framework for accurately predicting conditional average treatment effects using both observational data and weak instrumental variables, overcoming limitations of…

item.title: Exogenous Matching: Learning Good Proposals for Tractable Counterfactual Estimation
item.description: Exogenous Matching learns optimal proposals for efficient counterfactual estimation by transforming variance minimization into conditional distribution learning, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Fast Proxy Experiment Design for Causal Effect Identification
item.description: This paper presents efficient algorithms for designing cost-optimal proxy experiments to identify causal effects, significantly improving upon prior methods.

item.title: Higher-Order Causal Message Passing for Experimentation with Complex Interference
item.description: Higher-Order Causal Message Passing (HO-CMP) accurately estimates treatment effects in complex systems with unknown interference by using observed data to learn the system’s dynamics over time.

item.title: Hybrid Top-Down Global Causal Discovery with Local Search for Linear and Nonlinear Additive Noise Models
item.description: Hybrid causal discovery algorithm efficiently learns unique causal graphs from observational data by leveraging local substructures and topological sorting, outperforming existing methods in accuracy …

item.title: Identifiability Guarantees for Causal Disentanglement from Purely Observational Data
item.description: This paper provides identifiability guarantees for causal disentanglement from purely observational data using nonlinear additive Gaussian noise models, addressing a major challenge in causal represen…

item.title: Identification and Estimation of the Bi-Directional MR with Some Invalid Instruments
item.description: PReBiM algorithm accurately estimates bi-directional causal effects from observational data, even with invalid instruments, using a novel cluster fusion approach.

item.title: Identifying Causal Effects Under Functional Dependencies
item.description: Unlocking identifiability of causal effects: This paper leverages functional dependencies in causal graphs to improve identifiability, leading to fewer needed variables in observational data.

item.title: Intervention and Conditioning in Causal Bayesian Networks
item.description: Researchers uniquely estimate probabilities in Causal Bayesian Networks using simple independence assumptions, enabling analysis from observational data and simplifying counterfactual probability calc…

item.title: Learning Mixtures of Unknown Causal Interventions
item.description: Researchers developed an efficient algorithm to uniquely identify causal relationships from mixed interventional and observational data with noisy interventions.

item.title: Linear Causal Bandits: Unknown Graph and Soft Interventions
item.description: Causal bandits with unknown graphs and soft interventions are solved by establishing novel upper and lower regret bounds, plus a computationally efficient algorithm.

item.title: Linear Causal Representation Learning from Unknown Multi-node Interventions
item.description: Unlocking Causal Structures: New algorithms identify latent causal relationships from interventions, even when multiple variables are affected simultaneously.

item.title: Marginal Causal Flows for Validation and Inference
item.description: Frugal Flows: Generate realistic causal benchmarks with exact marginal causal effects, enabling robust causal method validation.

item.title: Markov Equivalence and Consistency in Differentiable Structure Learning
item.description: Researchers developed a new, differentiable score function for learning causal relationships from data that reliably recovers the simplest causal model, even with complex data.

item.title: Mutli-Armed Bandits with Network Interference
item.description: New algorithms conquer regret in multi-armed bandits challenged by network interference, achieving provably low regret with both known and unknown network structures.

item.title: Nonparametric Instrumental Variable Regression through Stochastic Approximate Gradients
item.description: SAGD-IV: a novel functional stochastic gradient descent algorithm for stable nonparametric instrumental variable regression, excelling in handling binary outcomes and various loss functions.

item.title: On the Complexity of Identification in Linear Structural Causal Models
item.description: New polynomial-space algorithm for causal parameter identification in linear models vastly improves upon existing methods, showing that this crucial task is computationally hard.

item.title: On the Identifiability of Poisson Branching Structural Causal Model Using Probability Generating Function
item.description: Researchers developed a novel, efficient causal discovery method using Probability Generating Functions to identify causal structures within Poisson Branching Structural Causal Models, overcoming limi…

item.title: Partial Structure Discovery is Sufficient for No-regret Learning in Causal Bandits
item.description: Learning optimal interventions in causal bandits with unknown causal graphs is now efficient; this paper identifies the minimal causal knowledge needed and offers a two-stage algorithm with sublinear …

item.title: Proximal Causal Inference With Text Data
item.description: Unmeasured confounders hinder causal inference; this paper introduces a novel method using two pre-treatment text instances and zero-shot models to infer proxies for unobserved confounders, enabling p…

item.title: Qualitative Mechanism Independence
item.description: Researchers introduce QIM-compatibility, a novel framework for modeling qualitative relationships in probability distributions using directed hypergraphs, significantly expanding beyond standard condi…

item.title: Quantifying Aleatoric Uncertainty of the Treatment Effect: A Novel Orthogonal Learner
item.description: New orthogonal learner quantifies treatment effect’s randomness, providing sharper insights beyond average effects.

item.title: QWO: Speeding Up Permutation-Based Causal Discovery in LiGAMs
item.description: QWO: a novel method dramatically speeds up permutation-based causal discovery in linear Gaussian models, enabling the analysis of larger datasets and advancing causal inference.

item.title: Sample Efficient Bayesian Learning of Causal Graphs from Interventions
item.description: Efficiently learn causal graphs from limited interventions using a novel Bayesian algorithm that outperforms existing methods and requires fewer experiments.

item.title: Smoke and Mirrors in Causal Downstream Tasks
item.description: AI for science faces hidden biases in causal inference; this paper reveals these flaws using ant behavior data, introducing ISTAnt benchmark, and provides guidelines for more accurate causal AI.

item.title: Tangent Space Causal Inference: Leveraging Vector Fields for Causal Discovery in Dynamical Systems
item.description: Tangent Space Causal Inference (TSCI) enhances causal discovery in dynamical systems by leveraging vector fields, outperforming existing methods in accuracy and interpretability.

item.title: Towards Estimating Bounds on the Effect of Policies under Unobserved Confounding
item.description: This paper presents a novel framework for estimating bounds on policy effects under unobserved confounding, offering tighter bounds and robust estimators for higher-dimensional data.

item.title: Unified Covariate Adjustment for Causal Inference
item.description: Unified Covariate Adjustment (UCA) offers a scalable, doubly robust estimator for a wide array of causal estimands beyond standard methods.

item.title: When to Act and When to Ask: Policy Learning With Deferral Under Hidden Confounding
item.description: CARED: a novel causal action recommendation model improves policy learning by collaborating with human experts and mitigating hidden confounding in observational data.
